results.title: The Fatal glass of beer
results.creator_credit: Mack Sennett, Mack Sennett Comedies and Clyde Bruckman
results.brief_description: This film is about a prodigal son returning to a snowbound cabin in the Yukon. Described as an absurd star comedy with appeal to addicts only: most of the humour consists of repeats of one line, “Taint a fit night out for man nor beast”. This film was written by W.C. Fields who also starred in it, along with Rosemary Theby, George Chandler and Richard Cramer.

results.title: The Dismissal
results.creator_credit: John Power, Carl Schultz, George Ogilvie, Phil Noyce, George Miller, Terry Hayes and Kennedy-Miller
results.brief_description: A fictional account of the events that led up to the decision, made by Sir John Kerr, to sack Gough Whitlam as Prime Minister and appoint Malcolm Fraser in his place.

constellations_other.name: George Miller
constellations_other.description: For a guy who started his career as a physician, George Miller sure is a diverse filmmaker.

results.creator_credit_for_label: John Power, Carl Schultz, George Ogilvie, Phil Noyce, George Miller, Terry Hayes and Kennedy-Miller
results.description: A fictional account of the events that led up to the decision, made by Sir John Kerr, to sack Gough Whitlam as Prime Minister and appoint Malcolm Fraser in his place. The events covered occurred over the period between 1972 and 1975 and have been arranged, in the film, into six parts. Cast: Peter Carroll, Bill Hunter, John Hargreaves, John Meillon, Max Phipps, John Stanton, Arthur Dignam, Ruth Cracknell, Nancy Hayes.

results.title: Sun, wind and wood
results.creator_credit: Dorothy Todd Henaut, Kathleen Shannon, Margaret Pettigrew, Edward Le Lorrain and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: There are people who are fighting the high cost of energy by devising ingenious ways to use sun, wind and wood. This film illustrates the nature of these experiments, one of which is the Ark, a bio-shelter that, using natural systems only, provides housing, heat, food and electricity for a family.

results.title: The Freshman
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “New Versions of Comedy Classics”.
This film is a new restored print of a 1925 comedy. “The Freshman” is about country boy Harold who goes to college and, after many tribulations, saves the day when he makes the winning touchdown at the big game.

results.title: Rape culture
results.creator_credit: Renner Wunderlich, Margaret Margaret Lazarus and Cambridge Documentary Films
results.brief_description: This film explores those elements in our society which contribute to the ideology that supports rape. It attempts to expand our society’s narrow and sexist concept of rape and establishes the connections between violence and “normal” patterns of male-female behaviour. Includes the opinions of convicted rapists, rape crisis centre workers, and others associated with the problem.

results.title: The Sentimental bloke
results.creator_credit: Raymond Longford and Southern Cross Film Co
results.brief_description: Classic adaptation of C.J. Dennis’ verse narrative of life in inner Sydney in the 1910s, rich in incident but centring on the romance and marriage of the Bloke and Doreen. Filmed on location in Sydney’s Woolloomooloo and the Hornsby Valley (the orchard scene), it was ahead of its time in the naturalness of the performances from a carefully chosen cast. Starring Arthur Tauchert, Lottie Lyell and Gilbert Emery.

results.title: Not a love story
results.creator_credit: Bonnie Sherr Klein, Dorothy Todd Henaut and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A thought provoking chronicle of the odyssey of two women motivated by the desire to know more about pornography - why it exists, the forms it takes and how it affects the relations between men and women. It offers insights and perspective’s from men and women who earn their living from the porn trade, and from some of pornography’s most outspoken critics.

results.title: Tread softly
results.creator_credit: Rolf De Heer, Di Drew and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
Claire (Robyn Nevin) and Angela (Natalie Bate) have only been been living together for a short time but Claire’s constant attention has already become suffocating to Angela. She needs space and time to be alone.
The painful final stages of an affair that is over but not yet finished.

results.title: The Girl who met Simone de Beauvoir in Paris
results.creator_credit: Richard Brennan, Richard Wherrett and AFTRS
results.brief_description: Regarded as one of Australia’s acclaimed theatre and artistic directors, Richard Wherrett has transformed his directing skills into film with this adaptation of “The Girl who met Simone de Beauvoir in Paris. Cast includes Tony Llewellyn-Jones, Judy Morris, Anna Volska and John Clayton. Director of Photography, Geoff Burton.

results.title: El Salvador: another Vietnam
results.creator_credit: Tete Vasconcellos, Glenn Silber and Catalyst Media Productions
results.brief_description: Investigates the history of the crises and the forces that have embroiled the United States in this Central American conflict. The film follows the sad history of El Salvador from fifty years of dictatorship, through the civilian-military junta of 1979 and a growing dependency on American aid. Narrated by Mike Farrell.
